p: The current dengue clinical classification, proposed by WHO in 2009, includes central nervous system (CNS) involvement in the definition of SD requiring intensive care and supportive management [ 57]. DENV infections in endemic regions have long been recognized for their neuronal manifestations [ 62, 63], where frequency ranges from 0.5% to 21% [ 60], and the incidence rate for strokes is less than 1% [ 30, 37]. Generally, patients develop early non-specific symptoms such as fever, headache, myalgia and exanthema, with initial and transient resolution, followed by recrudescence of headache, fever and neurological symptoms onset [ 23], similar to our patient 1, who, in recovery phase, progressed to neuronal impairment.
